definition: big sister/elder sister/older sister (also polite term of address for a girl or woman slightly older than the speaker)
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
common word for ladybug, more formally 瓢虫

sentences.english: The deal fell through with Wayan.
Hydrangea is a spherical gold chrysanthemums hunters.
sentences.chinese: 金绣球是球状菊花的大姐大。

sentences.english: My big sister is seventeen and she's only half-crazy.
sentences.chinese: 约翰尼说，“我的大姐是17岁，而她有一半疯狂。”

sentences.english: I don't want to tell Wayan about it, not until all the money has been raised.
sentences.chinese: 在筹得所有的钱之前，我不打算告诉大姐这件事。

sentences.english: A brown spotted lady-bug climbed the dizzy height of a grass blade.
sentences.chinese: 一只背上有棕色斑点的花大姐趴在一片草叶的叶尖。

sentences.english: There is the Oedipus Complex, at best, so easy to marry a wife more than Sister.
sentences.chinese: 有恋母情结的，充其量容易娶个大姐做老婆而已。

sentences.english: As Jane was the eldest, she looked after the others.
sentences.chinese: 珍妮是大姐，所以她照顾其他弟妹。

sentences.english: To get Tutti back, Wayan had to hire a lawyer, whom she paid with every single thing she had.
sentences.chinese: 为了争取图蒂，大姐必须散尽所有的一切去聘请律师。

sentences.english: I'm starting to get kind of panicked about this whole Wayan house situation.
sentences.chinese: 我对大姐买屋的整个情况，开始感到恐慌。

sentences.english: And God was begging Liz to please help Wayan, too.
sentences.chinese: 而神也求小莉来一起帮助大姐。

sentences.english: Her family was quite well-off, and the husband of her eldest sister was the county's governor of the then Republican Government.
sentences.chinese: 家境好，大姐夫又是这个城市里国民政府的一县之长。

sentences.english: Sister Liu is engaged in making clothes for an orphan.
sentences.chinese: 刘大姐正忙于替一位孤儿做衣服。

sentences.english: I went to my oldest sister and she gave me some money.
sentences.chinese: 于是我就去和大姐商量，她给了我几元钱。

sentences.english: Palmer the temple to find their own lover complaining of elder sister Ann.
sentences.chinese: 帕巴坦去找自己的相好颂安大姐诉苦。

sentences.english: Tigress,I'm a big fan of you.
sentences.chinese: 虎大姐，我是你的超级粉丝。

sentences.english: Venus Williams I always like to win. But I'm the big sister.
sentences.chinese: 经常想自己赢，但我是大姐。

definition: maternal aunt/step-mother/childcare worker/nursemaid/woman of similar age to one's parents (term of address used by child)/CL:個|个[ge4]
older brother's wife/sister-in-law/elder sister (respectful appellation for an older married woman)
older female cousin via female line
father's elder brother's wife/aunt (affectionate term for an elderly woman)
eldest brother/big brother (polite address for a man of about the same age as oneself)/gang leader/boss
little sister/girl/(Tw) young female employee working in a low-level role dealing with the public (assistant, waitress, attendant etc)
